TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HttpContextWrapper extends System.Web.HttpContextBase

Docs.summary: Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that contains HTTP-specific information about an individual HTTP request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpContextWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpContextBase> class and serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> class. This class exposes the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> class and also exposes the <xref:System.Web.HttpContextBase> type. The <xref:System.Web.HttpContextBase> class lets you replace the original implementation of the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.

Docs.param: The object that should process the request.
Docs.summary: Enables you to specify a handler for the request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you set `handler` to `null`, the default handler is used to process the request. You can set `handler` to either an asynchronous handler or to an synchronous handler. The handler must implement the <xref:System.Web.IHttpHandler> interface.

Docs.exception: The method was called after the event occurred.

Docs.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies what type of session state behavior is required.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpContextWrapper.SetSessionStateBehavior%2A> method overrides the base <xref:System.Web.HttpContextBase.SetSessionStateBehavior%2A> method. To implement the base method, the <xref:System.Web.HttpContextWrapper.SetSessionStateBehavior%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.SetSessionStateBehavior%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> class and passes the `sessionStateBehavior` setting.
